intro: Bonatea pulchella, commonly known as the pretty bonatea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces vibrant flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Bonatea pulchella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
